filmography.title: West Side Story
filmography.role_description: The charismatic, acrobatic leader of the Jets street gang who is fiercely loyal to his territory and his best friend, Tony.
filmography.plot: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmography.awards: Film won 10 Oscars including Best Picture; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#51), 100 Passions (#3)

filmography.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
filmography.role_description: The youngest of the seven ruffian brothers, who falls for a local girl and uses his acrobatic skills in the film's famous barn-raising dance sequence.
filmography.plot: In 1850 Oregon, when a backwoodsman brings a wife home to his farm, his six brothers decide they want to get married too.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Scoring of a Musical Picture; AFI: Greatest Movie Musicals (#21)

filmography.title: Peyton Place
filmography.role_description: A shy, sensitive high school student dominated by his overprotective mother, struggling to find his own identity.
filmography.plot: The dark secrets of several residents in a small New England town are exposed.

filmography.title: The Haunting
filmography.role_description: The skeptical, wisecracking heir to the Hill House estate who joins a paranormal investigation to watch over his future property.
filmography.plot: A scientist invites three people to a haunted mansion to study its supernatural phenomena, but the house begins to terrorize one of them.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Director (Robert Wise)

filmography.title: Tom Thumb
filmography.role_description: A tiny, magical boy no bigger than a thumb who outwits two bumbling thieves to save his village's treasury.
filmography.plot: A tiny boy born to a honest woodcutter uses his wits to protect his parents and stop a pair of comical villains.

filmography.title: Gun Crazy
filmography.role_description: The younger version of the protagonist, a boy whose obsession with firearms leads him into trouble with the law.
filmography.plot: Two gun-obsessed lovers go on a violent crime spree that leads them to a tragic end.

filmography.title: Father of the Bride
filmography.role_description: The younger brother of the bride who observes the chaos of the wedding preparations with bemusement.
filmography.plot: The father of a young woman deals with the emotional pain and financial strain of her upcoming wedding.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture, Best Actor

filmography.title: The War of the Gargantuas
filmography.role_description: An American scientist working in Japan who helps authorities deal with two giant, hairy humanoid monsters battling across the country.
filmography.plot: An evil green monster attacks Japan, and his benevolent brown brother emerges to stop him.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned Confederate soldier who encounters Generals Grant and Sherman during the Civil War segment.
filmography.plot: A multigenerational saga following the Westward expansion of a family from the 1830s to the 1900s.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Screenplay, Best Film Editing, Best Sound

filmography.title: High School Confidential
filmography.role_description: A tough-talking, hipster transfer student who is actually an undercover narc trying to bust a high school drug ring.
filmography.plot: A tough kid new to high school tries to muscle his way into the local drug scene, but he has a secret agenda.

filmography.title: Samson and Delilah
filmography.role_description: A young soldier and future king of Israel who appears in a supporting capacity in this biblical epic.
filmography.plot: The biblical strongman Samson falls victim to the beautiful and treacherous Delilah.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm
filmography.role_description: Tamblyn plays two roles in the fantasy segments: a woodsman in 'The Dancing Princess' and reprising his role as Tom Thumb.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about Wilhelm and Jacob Grimm interspersed with three of their famous fairy tales.

filmography.title: Hit the Deck
filmography.role_description: A sailor and the Admiral's son who tries to make it on Broadway while navigating romantic entanglements.
filmography.plot: Three sailors on shore leave in San Francisco find romance and trouble.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Most Promising Newcomer (Russ Tamblyn)

filmography.title: The Fastest Gun Alive
filmography.role_description: A townsperson who performs a memorable acrobatic 'shovel dance' during a community barn dance.
filmography.plot: A mild-mannered storekeeper is revealed to be a master gunfighter, drawing the attention of a criminal looking for a duel.

filmography.title: Cimarron
filmography.role_description: A young outlaw who crosses paths with the protagonist family during the Oklahoma Land Rush.
filmography.plot: A western epic spanning decades, following a family who moves to the Oklahoma territory during the Land Rush of 1889.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction, Best Sound

filmography.title: Don't Go Near the Water
filmography.role_description: A young, naive naval officer stationed on a remote island in the South Pacific who gets caught up in the unit's antics.
filmography.plot: A comedy about a US Navy public relations unit stationed on a Pacific island during World War II who find ways to avoid actual combat.

filmography.title: The Long Ships
filmography.role_description: A Viking warrior and brother to the main character, who joins the quest for a legendary golden bell.
filmography.plot: Vikings and Moors clash in a quest to find a legendary giant bell made of pure gold.

filmography.title: Son of a Gunfighter
filmography.role_description: The vengeful son of a notorious gunfighter who hunts down his father but gets caught in a conflict with a Mexican bandit.
filmography.plot: A young gunslinger seeks revenge on his outlaw father but eventually joins forces with him to fight a bandit leader.

filmography.title: Satan's Sadists
filmography.role_description: The sadistic, sunglasses-wearing leader of an outlaw biker gang who terrorizes a group of strangers in the desert.
filmography.plot: A Vietnam veteran fights to save a waitress and himself from a violent motorcycle gang in the American Southwest.

filmography.title: Dracula vs. Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: A biker who gets involved in the bizarre events surrounding the resurrection of the two legendary monsters.
filmography.plot: Dracula conspires with a descendant of Dr. Frankenstein to revive the monster, hoping to use a special serum to cure his own vulnerability to sunlight.

filmography.title: Human Highway
filmography.role_description: The best friend of the protagonist Lionel, working at a gas station diner on the last day of Earth.
filmography.plot: A surreal, post-apocalyptic musical comedy about the eclectic employees and patrons of a gas station diner.

filmography.title: Follow the Boys
filmography.role_description: A naval officer stationed in the Riviera who courts one of the women following the fleet.
filmography.plot: A group of women travel to the French Riviera to be near their husbands and boyfriends stationed on a U.S. Navy ship.

filmography.title: Drive
filmography.role_description: A small but memorable role as an underworld doctor who patches up the driver after a job goes wrong.
filmography.plot: A mysterious Hollywood stuntman and mechanic moonlights as a getaway driver and finds himself in trouble when he helps his neighbor.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Director; Oscar: Nominated – Best Sound Editing

filmography.title: Django Unchained
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a townsperson, a nod to his starring role in the 1965 western 'Son of a Gunfighter'.
filmography.plot: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Screenplay, Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Cabin Boy
filmography.role_description: A bizarre, magical half-man, half-shark creature who appears to the protagonist during his hallucination/adventure.
filmography.plot: A snobby rich kid mistakenly boards a fishing boat instead of a luxury cruise and is forced to work as a cabin boy.
